subject: p19404187
History: Fever, in a patient with gastrointestinal bleeding and recent endoscopy.
Findings: Portable AP radiograph of the chest was compared to, and. Extensive opacification of left mid and lower lobe with frank consolidation in the left lower lobe and partial atelectasis as well as right lower lobe opacity are new since and have substantially progressed since. These findings might be consistent with multifocal aspiration or pneumonia with at least partial atelectasis of the left lower lobe. Bilateral pleural effusion is most likely present. There is no evidence of pneumothorax, or pneumomediastinum.
